column4: Hey guys, I'm trying to rip an audio cd using lame in command line mode
but though i can see in nautilus browser the audio cd content, how can I ls the files in the terminal?
wot could be the right path for an audio cd if i want to browse from the terminal/cmd line?
that's because audio cd's are really files. rip them first if you want to see them. or look at them via rhythmbox
if you're trying to rip an audio cd use "ripperX" .. should be in the repo's.
